summary:
www.kerkelov.com

Peter Kerkelov (b. 1984) is a Bulgarian composer currently based in The Netherlands. He holds master’s degree in composition from The Royal Conservatoire in The Hague, The Netherlands, where he studied under Martijn Padding and Guus Janssen; master's degree in composition under prof. Dimitar Tapkov and Bachelor degree in classical guitar under Milena and Valentin Valchevi from Academy of Music, Dance and Fine Arts (AMDFA) in Plovdiv, Bulgaria. Peter has specialized composition with prof. Dan Dediu at the National Music University, Bucharest, Romania, 2006/2007, graduating with distinction.

His composition “Attempt at screaming”, written for ASKO/Schoenberg Ensemble, is the winner of UNESCO's 59th International Rostrum of Composers in Stockholm, 2012. Other awards include a scholarship from the British Music Society for attendance at the "Gaudeamus Music Week" in Amsterdam, 2006; a scholarship from the Wagner Society and he is two-time scholarship winner for classical music from the Raina Kabaivanska Foundation.
   
Peter’s compositions have been performed by renowned performers like Asko/Schoenberg Ensemble, "Bang on a Can All-Stars", ensemble "Musica Nova" (Bulgaria), Ensemble Klang and have been taking part in distinguished festivals such as Gaudeamus Music Week (The Netherlands), March Music Days (Bulgaria) and the annual New Bulgarian Music Preview (Bulgaria).

He has been selected for masterclasses with Louis Andriessen, David Lang and Kaija Saariaho. 

Current projects include commissions by Orchestre Philharmonique de Radio France and International Music Council for "Presences festival". Peter has been commissioned by The Royal Conservatoire, Duo Cajon and Ruysdael Kwartet. 
 
His scores have been published and recorded by Union of Bulgarian Composers, Bulgarian National Radio, “BalkaNota” and AMDFA.
